greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of polyominoes with n edges, including inner edges.
comment: n-celled polyomino with perimeter p has (4n+p)/2 edges. The maximum number of edges in an n-celled polyomino is 3n+1.
example: A single cell has 4 edges; a domino has 7 edges (this includes the edge between the two cells); both triominoes have 10 edges; their possible orientations are not considered distinct. Thus a(4) = a(7) = 1, a(10) = 2, and a(n) = 0 for n < 10 not equal to 4 or 7.

a(22) = 85 = 83 + 2: there are 83 polyominoes with 7 cells and perimeter 16 (such as a 1 X 7 strip) and two polyominoes with 8 cells and perimeter 12 (a 3 X 3 square without a corner and a 4 X 2 rectangle), and each of these polyominoes has 22 edges.
xref: Cf. A000105, A057730, A342243. A131482: a(n) is the number of n-celled polyominoes with perimeter 2n+2. A131488: analog for hexagonal tiling.
results.author: _Tanya Khovanova_, Jul 28 2007
